website_summaries.verdict: This jacket is heavy-duty, warm and waterproof, making it the best option.
pros: Soft fleece lining keeps you warm, while the waterproof exterior coating keeps you dry
Gets top marks for the earphone line fastening and supporting fixture inside the jacket
cons: Some issues with zippers breaking or sticking

website_summaries.verdict: A premium men's snowboarding jacket that is both fashionable and functional.
pros: Water-repellent jacket ensures you are protected against snow, sleet, rain and other inclement weather conditions
Efficient lining helps you stay warm
Includes multiple pockets for added convenience
Comes in a variety of colors and sizes
cons: Jacket pocket zippers tend to break easily

customer_reviews.title: Seams ripped on second day. Inferior stitching is very ...
customer_reviews.text: Seams ripped on second day. Inferior stitching is very weak. While the jacket fits perfectly (see photos) the underarm seams popped and ripped as I simply donned the coat. I've requested refund and am nervous about the customer service, having read much of other customer's negative experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zippers = No Go
customer_reviews.text: Pros: keeps you warm, looks nice, many pockets and layers. Cons: The zipper broke within a week and I had to cut out the pocket to get to my phone! I saw reviews about the cheap zipper material they used, and sure enough the reviews didn't lie! The price was good, but not enough to sacrifice a few hours of frustration trying to get a zipper to work. Will return and head to Columbia
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coat this month...it was nice and warm and I really liked it. The pocket zipper got stuck twice and because the stichting is so poor trying to free it the entire pocket ripped off the coat...obviously the coat is trash now and $70 down the drain. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Skully107

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality and zero quality control
customer_reviews.text: Beware!! This is a very cheaply made garment. When I received it new from the package, the stitching near the left pocket, that is single stitched, was already unravelled, and the left pocket zippers were dangling and barely stitched on. I hadn't even put the thing on yet! Very poor quality and zero quality control. AND, I lost $14.38 in the transaction just returning the garment! Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality specially stiching!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks very good. Good packaging and timely delivery. After using it for a month I find very two basic but very important flaws in the jacket. 1. Waist pocket is not covered, so when you open the pockets, especially for putting your hands in the pocket, wind can easily pass through it. Your hands and whole body get cold. 2. Very poor quality stitching. Stitching of the jacket has opened up under my armpits. The whole jacket become useless now.I just wasted a lot of money on a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Pankaj S.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a nice jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this jacket for a ski trip after shopping stores. You cannot beat the price for the quality and look of this jacket. Be sure to use the sizing chart and you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Helm

customer_reviews.title: Very warm but not waterproof or resistant
customer_reviews.text: So this is a very warm jacket and very windproof but certainly no where near waterproof or even water resistant. I even tried to added waterproof sprays on this but the material is too porous and will just get soaked. So just be aware of that if you are looking to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: BryanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Received the item and it was ripped!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this jacket two times and both times I have received it... it has been ripped!!!!! The first time was in the pocket and I sent it back... second time was the whole shoulder!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brayden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Weather Proof Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I recently went to Iceland and of course in preparation I purchased this coat. It was possibly the best purchase I had made for the entire trip. I was in cold snowy weather and remained at a comfortable warm temperature. On top of that I visited 4 waterfalls, including 1 that completely soaked my jacket yet the water nevere got through and I remained warm. It was a perfect jacket.
customer_reviews.author: julius

customer_reviews.title: This is the worth jacket i have ever bought in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the worth jacket i have ever bought in my life. The stitching is too weak that it tears with in 2 months of use. Especially the arm pits area of both arms got torn with in 2 months of gentle use
customer_reviews.author: ROSH

customer_reviews.title: I liked this so much, I bought another and will buy a third
customer_reviews.text: We take the boat out on the lake fishing in cold weather ... it's like riding a motorcycle in cold weather, only worse! so I bought this jacket in a small thinking it might fit our thirteen year old. Everything about it was impressive, from the jacket, to the packaging, to the delivery time. The wife and I also need jackets so we ordered the same in Medium for her since the Small was a little tight for her. Once we get that, I'll order one for me based on how her's fits me. So far, she says they fit exactly as she expected from the size charts.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Branscum

customer_reviews.title: YEET
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6"2, 190lbs, and a lage fits just about right. The arms aren't as long as I'd like, but it's only a problem when I lift my arms over my head. I'd recommend buying a size up ONLY if you have long arms like I do. It felds well to my long torso, and I'm pretty sure it will hold up against the coming Minnesota winter. 8/10 UPDATE: It ripped, shrunk, zippers fell off... If you love yourself, just get a Carhartt coat. They're cheeper and better. 4/10
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected...
customer_reviews.text: I went to NY past DEC 2019, it was very cold, I brought my NorthFace Jacket for the cold and I also bought this Wantdo in case something happened with my NorthFace... When I tried this Wantdo Jacket I immediately felt it warmer and comfortable than the NorthFace to be honest, I could not believed that I paid around 300 dollars for the Northface and the Wantdo Jacket offered better protection for less than half the price. I will never buy anything from NF again, this Wantdo stuff is great and it works perfectly. I am writting this 10 months later I went to NY and the Jacket is still as perfect as when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: NOT A MEN'S COAT!!!! NOT FOR COLD WEATHER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is completely inaccurately described and I have been fighting for a refund for MONTHS, which they will not give. This is a WOMEN'S jacket, and it is NOT for cold weather as it is described. I am completely upset and no one seems to want to do anything about the issue. I am out money for a jacket I bought for a MAN, and it is NOT for a man, but for a WOMAN!!! Please be weary of your purchases!!! NOT HAPPY AT ALL, and that isn't saying the half of how we feel!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I feel this jacket runs on the small side. Exceptional customer service. The vendor couldn't have been more helpful to resolve, when I emailed I needed the Large. My son is 5' 9" 145lbs. @ 13yrs. old. Note... we tried on ski/snowboard jackets @ stores, and the small just fit, and Adult Medium seemed to the correct size, but not in this jacket. They refunded me (though it hasn't processed through yet) & let me keep it, and I bought the Large. Excellence to detail. I read several complaints about the zipper. I won't know until used this winter. I hope the quality is as good as it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hart

customer_reviews.title: Warm coat even in extreme temps
customer_reviews.text: I've had this coat for several months and waited to review it. This has been a great warm jacket at an unbelievable price. I normally spend 2x-3x more on my winter jackets because I live in the NE and winters can rough. The other night I was wearing this jacket when it was 12 degrees F and wind gusts up to 25MPH. I was outdoors for approx 3 hours in these conditions and never felt cold. The designers added pockets in useful locations on the inside and outside of this jacket. I can keep my cell phone in a zippered pocket next to my chest and I feel secure it won't get wet, damaged, or fall out.
customer_reviews.author: PolishRifle

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made, Not Warm below 0 C.
customer_reviews.text: It fits great, looks great, it's properly water proof, but it is NOT WARM. I'm in Ukraine and at -10 C with some wind I can't be outside for more than ten minutes without shivering. I'm pretty good with cold tolerance and also have under liners and such. It's great for 0 C but not below. Also the cuffs don't hold for more than a week, since it's not proper Velcro. Zippers are also of cheap Chinese manufacture. I excepted much more for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: The Adventure Medic

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre, not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: It's a decently warm jacket, a little expensive for the build quality and definitely NOT waterproof. I am not sure I would even call it water resistant. It has good wind resistance with the including anti-wind waist and hand skirting. My problem is finding a truly water proof jacket that is warm, I have tried so many and found all of them seriously lacking in either warmth or basic water resistance. I live in the Pacific Northwest where it rains a lot, and I have a job outdoors. This past week it was 36f/2c and raining hard, I wore it in the rain and it was soaking into the arms in about 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Workmanship quality issues(quality control)
customer_reviews.text: When I received my jacket, the stitching on the left outside coat pocket was completely missing, leaving a hole to the back of the jacket exposed. Had I received my jacket the way it was supposed to be, with solid stitching and seams, I imagine I would have given it 4-5 stars. Also, the size is a little on the smaller side. Returning this large for an x large.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Villavaso

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT winter coat
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband because he loved the womens version I bought for myself. He took this on a winter backpacking trip and said it kept him warm and dry on the top of a VERY windy mountain at night in 14 degrees. Washed well and the campfire smell came right out of it. We LOVE this coats and expect they will last a very long time even with the beating we will be giving them. Also, I did my research. This is the BEST coat for the money, trust me! And wait for it to go on sale, it does often and you can save $15-$20.
customer_reviews.author: Free Advice

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money...I'm 6' 1" 275# and the 3XL is perfect....
customer_reviews.text: Ok after reading reviews, following the product for a while...I went for it and got this jacket. I'm 6' 1" and 280# and I got the 3XL (6XL Asian) and it fits great ! Room to move comfortably, layer clothes..arm lengths are great. All stitching in place and no rips/tears. Feels really nice and warm. Retail is 299, Amazon Prime 72.00 , I got a 2 hour Prime time deal 58.00 !! Delivered in 2 days. You will not find a jacket like this...for the price. It's great for everything from snowboarding to hiking...wouldn't summit a mountain with it, but a VERY good bang for the buck !
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Word

customer_reviews.title: Saved my first visit to New York Manhattan, and I'm from Miami Florida lol
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jacket for my first time visiting New York city in the winter I'm 5'10 weighing 215lbs I got the Large and it fits just right,if your as tall as me and weigh more I suggest the x-Large I was probably 5-10lbs away from being uncomfortable. Once we landed we were met with snow fall 30F, and I had no idea how the Subway system worked in Manhattan. I walked 23 blocks to get to my hotel in plain snowfall through the streets. This jacket truly saved me and kept this Miami Florida man warm lol, sometimes it's the little details like having a proper jacket that can make or break a vacation get away.
customer_reviews.author: Fc3sluis

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Initially I really liked this jacket but the low quality construction and components have come to light. Velcro on right cuff quit attaching after a week. Zipper on inside pocket broke shortly there after. Seam between fleece and Interior pockets already pulled apart. Great design, just poor follow through.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a police uniform-type fleece-lined jacket as my winter coat for 20 years now -- it was never the most comfortable, since it's designed to go above a gun belt and was kinda cheap. When it was finally starting to wear out this year, I shopped around for a new coat, and found this Wantdo one. Not only is it much warmer than the duty jacket, it's a lot more comfortable and solves every flaw in my old jacket. I especially like the depth of the glove pockets -- they allow even heavy winter gloves to be carried flat, so there's no big bulge in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Gindjurra

customer_reviews.title: It's a Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I ordered one Medium and one Large, expecting that I'd keep the one that fit and that I'd return the one that didn't fit. Unfortunately, neither jacket fit; they both were too small. (I have wide shoulders.) Both jackets were returned without any hassle. I ordered an Extra Large, which fit my shoulders and was not too big in other parts of the jacket. This jacket was well designed and constructed and shows good workmanship. This is a heavy jacket that will keep you warm, but it was not too warm when I left it open while shopping in stores.
customer_reviews.author: W. Zienert

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Coat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the warmest coat I have ever seen! I bought this for my husband but if it is super cold and he is not wearing it, I will put on the over sized to me coat and wear it. You don't even feel cold! I wish I could find a female version. Completely worth the price. Honestly I would say this is low priced for the product you are getting. His only complaint is the velcro on one arm by the hand opening will not stay down and it bugs him. Other than that, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Solid jacket for light usage
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a long weekend skiing/snowmobiling in CO. Jacket was very warm and had good water resistantance - that said we were in snow not rain so your mileage may vary. I'm 6'1" and could of used another inch or 2 of length for the sleeves and waist but generally fit was good. Materials and build quality are not high end and I doubt would hold up well to regular use but works fine for the occasional outing to the mountains. Price is fair for what you get. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Wentzel

customer_reviews.title: Very very thin jacket, certainly not suitable for skiing/snowboarding or anything serious
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a large and it came as an "XXL" with the zipper on the left side so I guess a women's jacket being sold as a mens? That wasn't a huge deal but this jacket is very very thin, more of a minimal windbreaker. Looks ok but just no insulation and a few places where plastic touches the skin on the inside it is very very cold. NOT FOR SNOWBOARDING and NOT A WINTER COAT. You can probably survive a stiff breeze but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok but will not buy again or reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I like the jacket, it keeps warm during 0 degrees Celsius with just a thermal innerwear and a long sleeve t-shirt. Couple of things I didnt like it. The jacket outside is very thin and it always looks wrinkled. It's the first jacket I see with this problem which i dont like it at all. The color i bought is brown. But it's not that brown compared to the picture. These are the 2 things I didnt like
customer_reviews.author: Indocalido

customer_reviews.title: Warm, thick and fits just right.
customer_reviews.text: My husband goes to a mens retreat every single year with our church and he always tells me how cold it was because he would just wear his regular jacket, I bought him this jacket for valentines day and he fell in love with me all over again. This jacket does the job it was about 5° where he went skiing he feel in the snow plenty of times but this jacket kept him warm. I'm going to order the rest of our family these jackets for when we go skiing and tubing. You wont regret getting it. It's worth your money and you can use it over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: SheanJimmy

customer_reviews.title: Received this a day ago, have worn it out ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this a day ago, have worn it out a couple times, temps are between 0 and 10 degrees and been quite warm. I am 5'8" and weigh 185, went with an XL so I could wear a hoodie under it and have plenty of room. Coat is not to baggy and can wear it in the car no problem. Only complaint, the string to tighten the hood snapped the second I pulled on the right side. Not a huge deal for me, will probably never use the hood. Excited to continue wearing it and see how it does!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Andis

customer_reviews.title: Very, very nice jacket for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’2 225lbs and the xxl fit well. The xl still fit, but was a little tight in the shoulders and restricted movement. I went snowmobiling in -16°F and ended up unzipping because I was too warm with added base and mid layers. The following day I went skiing in 10°F with just a thin base layer and again ended up unzipping to cool off once I started to be active. I have been pretty rough on the jacket the paper week and have had no issues with tearing or the zippers. My only complaint it that it could use more interior zippered pockets. Very, very nice jacket for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Last one winter, little wear but great for winter
customer_reviews.text: Move to Colorado in December and purchase this jacket. Used it for one winter and hung it up, pulled it out of the closet wear it for one day when it snowed and right down the seam on the side it ripped. I was walking from my car with groceries in my hands when it happened. So I give it two stars because for the price I paid I felt like it should have been better made. I do have to say it was great for the time that I got to wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Horrible stitching!!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and feeling coat but can't even zip it up cause the zipper seam isn't stitched even so fabric gets stick in zipper every time. Going to break any time so I'm returning. Quality s horrible. Will spend a few extra bucks and get an llbean or timberland one so it will last. This one is so poorly made that my husband would need a new one next year too. Beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for 3 days!
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Great delivery & very warm coat for sking & snowboarding. The XL size for a 6'2", 210 lb. highschool senior fit perfectly. CON: After the 3rd day of snowboarding, the zipper cloth seperated from the zipper line at the bottom. (18 year old said he kept the bottom snapped when the coat was zipped up.) After that time, whenever the coat was zipped, it would separate from bottom up. (Glad I brought a spare coat for skiing.) See the attached picture to see how the zipper tore apart at the bottom. Bottom line, very nice coat FOR 3 DAYS.
customer_reviews.author: J Braswell

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these jackets for my son and daughter for our ski trip to Breckenridge. They both raved about how warm the jacket kept them. I can't speak to the quality of the stitching, as I've seen reviews knocking the jacket for that very issue; however, my son hit the snow quite a few times as a new snow boarder and he had no issues with tearing or stiching giving way. The sizing chart worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I previously wore Columbia jackets that lasted for at least 8-10 years before requiring replacement. This shoddily assembled jacket was warm, but not made to last. My puppy somehow managed to get his paw stuck in one of the pockets and when he pulled it broke the zipper and ripped a gaping hole in the shell. Any decently constructed jacket would've survived that with minimal damage if any at all. Not this shoddy jacket. If you want something cheap and decently warm that may last several years this is for you. If you want something that will last get a Columbia jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9" 220lbs. 46" chest. I ordered the men's XL and the jacket fit perfectly. Other reviews mentioned poor zipper quality and a tendency to rip in the underarm area. The zipper in the coat I received looked like it was a decent quality, and I noticed reinforced stitching in the underarm area, so perhaps the manufacturers read some of those reviews and made some adjustments to the product. Anyway, I've only had the coat for a few days, and so I have no idea how it holds up to long-term use, so unless it fails to get me all the way through this winter, then I will leave my rating at 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley T.

customer_reviews.title: So Warm, You May Even Sweat!
customer_reviews.text: Best winter coat I ever bought. Temps get down to 15 degrees and lower if it's being mean here in Detroit, but if you layer up properly, you're good. It's a ski jacket, so they're not playing around with keeping out the wind. There are snaps, drawstrings, and zipper covers everywhere designed to trap the heat in, and keep the chill out! It even keeps the air from sneaking in thru your sleeve hole/glove area. It's like the pants with stirrups for ladies, but for your hands, lol! That thing does hurt a little because it's a little tight between the thumb/finger area, but that's literally my only complaint. Very nice jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Winter Coat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, and it works well. He enjoyed the fit of the coat, and how warm it kept him. None of the winter weather got into it when he was playing outside. A few times he complained about being overwarm because of it kept his body heat in when he was running and playing. The cuffs stayed nicely tucked under his gloves to keep his wrists from being exposed to the snow/cold where it normally would have issues. Also, the hood closed up nicely to block the wind from blowing in his face.
customer_reviews.author: WImotherof2

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a birthday gift and my husband loved the comfy loose but warm fit
customer_reviews.text: Received 1/7/18. Bought as a birthday gift and my husband loved the comfy loose but warm fit. However Very poor quality!! The outer layer of cloth feels like cheesecloth and it just tore, literally split open today about an inch on the front right and not even 60 days later today. Does not even wear it all the time and only to go out on weekends as he wears a uniform for work. Very disappointed to say the least. Return window expired 2/7 so stuck with this now defective product. As compared to other reviews, at least the zippers still work.
customer_reviews.author: GcR

customer_reviews.title: Liars
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket I love it just today I found out it's not waterproof. From 7am till 10am. I was shoveling snow and I got soaked.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Overall great coat with some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: If you want a warm quality made coat this will fit your needs. Its very warm and has several features to help keep you warm. I do however have two complaints. Occasionaly the zipper opens up from the bottom which not only exposes you to the elements but also requires you to force the zipper down I am worried that i'll break the teeth and render the zipper useless. (If that happens I'll update this to 1 star) additionally the velcrow on the cuffs was steonger than the thread used to stitch it. As a result within one day the velcrow had torn off the cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mandenberg

customer_reviews.title: Yet another excellent product i purchased for my sons school trip
customer_reviews.text: Yet another excellent product i purchased for my sons school trip. He's 5' 9" 160 lbs. I purchased a large. It was a good fit. He has a slim waist and this coat fit him slightly big. I wanted it that way since he was going to wear several layers underneath to keep him warm in the snow. The good thing with this coat it has a band to tighten in the bottom so it looks good and put together without the many layers. The inside of the coat is nice as well. It has a soft material in the interior which kept my son warm. Btw, it also looks trendy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarita

customer_reviews.title: I have had good luck purchasing through Amazon and 3rd party sellers but ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this jacket is inferior. I purchased for my grandson for Christmas and by the first week in February the zipper fell apart and the seams under both arms came undone leaving huge openings in the outer cover of the jacket and exposing the insulation. The coat is no longer useable and we have to buy him another coat. (We live in MA and winters are cold.) I emailed the seller and after 5 days still have not received a response. I have had good luck purchasing through Amazon and 3rd party sellers but not with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best coat for the price
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is stupidly awesome. It's super comfortable, warm and functional. Some of the features include: -Soft fleece inside making it extremely cozy, comfortable and warm -Multiple pockets for storing your wallet, phone, equipment tools etc. -Velcro straps on the cuffs for a snug fit to keep out snow -An elastic liner inside the jacket to keep snow from sneaking up inside -Removable hood -Amazingly good deal price-wise -Looks and fits well too. The length is perfect as is sleeve lengths. I cannot reccomend this enough. I give it the N Lee guarantee*. *Guarantee not valid as NLee has no affiliation with this company
customer_reviews.author: N. Lee

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME COAT! Perfect for snow machine!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I both have the same jackets. I got one in black and he has the green. We live in Alaska and purchased these for riding our snow machines. We have been in down to -30 temps and ride 50 to 100mph and not one bit of wind cuts through these jackets! We just purchased two more in different colors. EXCELLENT QUALITY, very light weight, definitely wind proof, and very warm with a couple thin base layers under them with no over heating or sweating. Highly recommend these jackets!
customer_reviews.author: J. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great price and worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: After reading extensive mixed reviews about quality and durability. On my experience, jacket was super warm (too warm for me), which is great for future trips to more intense weathers. Quality seems very well made. no big issues with zippers, only a slight uneven pocket (it is sewed diagonally), buit I can live with that for the price I paid. In general, great price and it will do the job! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: calrobles

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than my 700-fill puffer jackets
customer_reviews.text: I live in Northern Nevada where I have to ski and house-keep in typical 9°F weather. I've tried numerous jackets and this one beats down-filled puffer jackets costing twice as much. I bought a second one for me and another for my wife. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a much cheaper alternative to a cold weather jacket I saw at Cabela's for $300. I was super impressed by the quality. No snow or rain is getting through this baby. I volunteer as a disaster responder and can spend hours out in all kinds of weather. I found this coat perfect for 40 to 50 degrees and another layer underneath keeps me warm at 10 to 40 degrees. It also looks great, much more expensive and everyone wants to know where I got it. The colors are very true to the description.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: BEST COAT EVER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this coat. It's warm, stylish and functional. I received as a gift for Christmas and I can't believe how incredible it fit. The pockets are perfectly positioned, the zippers are smooth as butter and it keeps me warm as hell!!!! I will definitely be buying this brand again and would recommend this jacket to ANYONE looking for new winter coat. If there were 20-Stars I would give it 20
customer_reviews.author: Jack Meriwether

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size/pocket zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: It was too big for my husband. Even when following size chart .its built more for an “American” figure rather than a European figure. It is very warm though. It’s very wind resistant, he uses it when he rides in the winter. It is a bit baggy even with extra clothes underneath.... the breast pocket zipper broke almost the next day and is stuck in the middle and won’t work anymore. It’s like it’s stripped or broken.... hood is removable... it has a nice thin “fur” inside for extra warmth. Just wish it fit and the zipper worked ....
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coat!!  (For the price)
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this coat and have gotten many compliments on it (from my group of friends who all are big adventurists). SUPER comfortable and warm. The fur in the hood is the best bit. Very stylish, warm and comfortable. Have found a few threads that were left long but if that's all that is lacking in quality at this price point...this coat is a steal of a deal! Update: One of the pocket zippers gets stuck most of the time it is used. A bit frustrating but really not overly terrible when considering the price of the coat. Still a shame though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Rawls

customer_reviews.title: Very warm without the weight.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. There is nothing about this coat that I didn't like. It's very light in weight yet keeps you warm even in the coldest temperatures. I don't live in the Hymalayas but it gets cold here in the Northeast. The coast has several pockets and no zip out liner to lose. The hood can also be removed however it's not so large that it gets in the way. The price it right too for a coat designed to be worn in temps as cold as in the mountains in winter. I can highly recommend this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Glockman4519

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: these sizes are NOT U.S sizes
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: these sizes are NOT U.S sizes even thought it says U.S 2XL it really mean U.S Medium. if you are a 2XL U.S like me you need to buy the 7XL in the options do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: We live in New England and my husband needs a nice warm heavy duty winter coat to go out in. So I was pleasantly surprised when I ordered this jacket for him. Its super warm on the inside and would make a great ski coat. But its nice enough to put over good clothing for a night out and not freeze! He typically wears an XL but I ordered a 2XL because other reviews said it ran a little small. The 2XL fits like a L/XL, so definitely order a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: 6 months so far no problems
customer_reviews.text: There were mixed reviews but I gave this coat a try and after 6 months I've had no issues. It was warm enough all winter and there were no problems with durability. However I didn't do anything like skiing, only wore it as a winter jacket for basic use like going to work or the store, so the jacket wasn't under a lot of stress. The elastic cuff wasn't long enough on the sleeve for me to use the thumb hole comfortably, but it still worked as a good seal around my wrist to keep snow from going up my sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mead

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Jacket arrived with a large rip in a seam. Poor quality, which appears to be a common complaint among buyers. As far as sizing goes, I am 6' 3", and 200 lbs. Bought an XXL. Arm length and shoulder width was good. Very wide in the body. For an athletic coat (skiing), I prefer something not so baggy and bulky. Will return, not replace.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H

customer_reviews.title: Very warm winter coat!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Iowa so it gets plenty cold here in the winter. My 17 year old son needed a warm winter coat and this is just the ticket! This is a really warm coat! It's a heavier coat but not overly bulky. It fits perfectly and is a nice looking coat. Looks exactly like the picture. I would totally recommend this coat for anyone looking for a very warm winter coat.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie16

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: I've used this jacket for 2 days so far on a ski trip and it is great. There is an issue with the zippers from what I read in the reviews but with that knowledge I have been gentil on them and haven't had an issue. It has been very warm with not much layering. As far the for the reviews were right and the sleeves being on the short side are correct, I'm 5'9 145 and it fits me pretty well. Would be nice if the sleeves were just a little longer but I'm not complaining. All in all it has been a good jacket for that a paid.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesnt last more than a few days on the slopes.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this jacket. It fit perfectly, but just after 4 days on the slopes, the seams came off under both the arms. Now i will have to look for a new one.. had i known i would have spent some more to get a north face or an equivalent jacket.
customer_reviews.author: PhoEniX

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says
customer_reviews.text: This jacket was bought for temps in the 30-60 degrees and hard rain. My son got it in time to wear during most recent storm system in Northern California and he was super happy. I asked how did the jacket do and the picture is his reply to me. My son is 6ft plus and has hips and backside. He even stated the size I got him was great as he could also keep his backpack dry. We are very happy with their purchase and look forward to buying more from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: Size runs small
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and layout but a large is not a large. I'm going to give this away and order an XL. I'm 5'5" and 180 but it's all in my belly, this thing is too small through the chest and shoulders. I was not given an exchange option, only a refund option that would not bein processing until the jacket has returned to Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Coat is toasty warm.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this coat would be warm. This week, however, the temperature hit -10F and wouldn't you know, my face and legs were freezing, but everything under the coat was toasty warm. It does break the wind well, and seems well built enough to last a full season. The zipper seems heavy duty, the only nit pick I have is the Velcro tabs on the cuffs seem kind of crappy. Eventually I think I'll have to cut them off, but that's a small issue.
customer_reviews.author: Iven

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to not fit all that well but, I find if you take the time to carefully consider the size chart that, it is as advertised and has now become my favorite jacket. I will be purchasing at least 2 more before the year (2019) is over.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Integrity

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Very Impressed with this Ski jacket immediately! It will definitely keep me very warm. One thing that stood out right away was the quality of the material for the over all coat but also the wrist cuffs. They feel very comfortable around my wrist and will definitely keep the wind and snow out of my jacket. Can't wait to hit the slopes with my new gear soon!
customer_reviews.author: Speedkilz

customer_reviews.title: Wantdo Men's Coat
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the coat and it came in 3 days. Checked it out thoroughly and the quality is good. Zippers work good and it does have draw strings at the bottom. It is not as heavy as you would think from the size of it. I am going on a trip to Vale Colorado in January so I will find out how warm it is and if it is waterproof. So far I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rich G.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is something worth looking at. I have yet to do a long term review because i just got it but considering the price tag that was attached to it in the box was retail at $300, $71 is the biggest product markdown ive seen. Is it worth that $300 price tag? Yes i think so because the features and quality of it is exactly what it should be. So you can make your own opinions but a $300 winter jacket for $71 is quite the deal and i was impressed with what i got. Never heard of Wantdo until i saw this coat but they did a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter S.

customer_reviews.title: but the zippers are horrible. The second day wearing the product the inner ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall the jacket works for wind/rain/snow....but the zippers are horrible. The second day wearing the product the inner chest zipper completely locked up and would not open. Normally this would be ok, if my wallet was not in it. I could not get the zipper to open and eventually had to cut open the jacket to access my wallet. This was a horrible design flaw which completely ruined my jacket! I wish I would have spent $20 more and purchased a brand name jacket. This company NEEDS to resolve this issue ASAP. I was going to recommend the jacket prior to this issue, but now I am left with a ripped up jacket after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice at first but ripped within the first month of light use.
customer_reviews.text: So this jacket was great for the first 3 weeks or so then the stitching on the shoulder tore a little from light use which was a huge disappointment since I actually really liked the jacket. It fits nicely and is very warm but after the small tear it just kept ripping down the seam so maybe the quality isn't as nice as it seemed at first. I can't even say I got my moneys worth out of this thing because of how short of a time it took for it to tear. So buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket For The Price, Just Needs Vents
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. Insanely warm. Too warm for early and late season so I wish it had a removable inner liner or at least some vents. Fit as expected. I wish I could have tried one on before purchasing. I normally run a large but I like a snug fit so I'm curious how a medium would have fit. With all the reviews of people saying it fits small I thought I'd be safe ordering a large. Well... the large fits like a large. Tadaaaa. Great jacket for the price though! I love it and I'm glad it's in my closet. The hood is huge btw. Definitely a weird fit and no straps to pull it down.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love the design!! Wonderful jacket for cold/snow/frigid temps!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS JACKET!! Purchased for my 15 year old son who is going skiing and snow tubing in Colorado. He LOVES all of the pockets, comfort, warmth, and the design of how they made the jacket. Loves how they thought of everything to make sure no snow or cold/wetness gets in!! Plus It’s not too bulky like other snow jackets are. Great for wearing with snow bib also!! Bravo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good value jacket for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I bought two of them. One for me and one for my girlfriend for our cruise to Alaska later this year. I tried mine on and instantly knew this jacket will be need our needs for our trip. Waterproof and as I have had many winter jackets in the past, I knew this would keep us warm and dry in Alaska's diverse weather conditions. Good value and I loved the little pouch it came in so that I can easily packet it in my suit case.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizes have been updated (Order with US standard size in mind)
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket, would highly recommend it. Made really well and super warm with tons of pockets and versatility. Disregard the reviews saying the size is off or too small. The company has changed its sizing to proper US sizes. In fact it may be a little bigger then US sizing; i normally wear a large and the large worked (with a little extra room). If you are a borderline Large you may want to get a medium.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pirelli

customer_reviews.title: Quality: 5, Sizing: 3=4 stars
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is a men’s so I thought it would be a little larger, especially since I bought a 3x. I’m glad I did though, because it’s snug everywhere but the arms and bust area. I’m a 3x sized lady and couldn’t find any ladies coats that I thought would fit. The coat is VERY warm, which is why it gets a 4, but I took away a start because the sizing runs small for American sizing norms.
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: I survived CHICAGO with this COAT
customer_reviews.text: I live in South Carolina and needed to visit Chicago this Christmas. Where do I start? This coat was awesome. The fur on the inside kept me so warm. Pockets are perfectly placed and great for headphones. The hood stops the chill and keeps me warm. In my opinion this coat can be worn in the Artic even Siberia. THE BAD: Started wearing very fast. Strings are coming loose everywhere. Going to get a lighter tomorrow to burn them but their are so many. THE GOOD: I wear this coat daily and it does not fail me, it does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Googles

customer_reviews.title: Rips & Tears extremely easily!
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket with lots of features & get lots of compliments. Outer layer of jacket is thin & tears if you walk near anything with an edge. If you walk near stuff, this jacket won’t last a day!
customer_reviews.author: Rick of Wood

customer_reviews.title: China be China
customer_reviews.text: Color is washed out and somehow even though sized up, the arms were still a bit too short for comfort Update: even sizing up doesn’t help with how uncomfortably short the sleeves are. You can’t really extend your hands without them pulling back like crazy. And the strap that’s supposed to keep its secure on the bottom keeps riding up all the time. Would not recommend for any activities.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Ripped one arm completely off on first day
customer_reviews.text: It's this simple..this is a very nice jacket. Personal preference comes into play here but this is MY review friends: great pockets, yes waterproof, fully tested today, and no zipper issues. Now this said, I didn't bundgie jump from a bridge in -10 weather and I didn't wipe out on the slopes 20 times while wrestling a grizzly bear. Runs big.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: Awful Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: It looked nice, the material seemed like good quality and fits me fine (A little long, I'm 5'6", 175 lbs - I got the Large) but the workmanship is awful. There was a tear in the seams which appears there was not enough material on one side and the fabrics were could not be sewn together. See the attached photos. I read some reviews and most were good reviews so I decided to buy it. I would have kept it if it was not for the tear. There were some complaints about the zippers. I agree the zippers could be better quality but will probably serve well enough as long as there are not abused or exert excess force.
customer_reviews.author: O Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: comes apart at the seams sewing not good at all (NOT RECOMENDED AS SELLER DOESENT CARE)
customer_reviews.text: i love this jacket but finding the thread is starting to come loose and out in most areas. hemming to the sleeves and a few other places.. just coming apart at the seam as they say.. other than that love this thing, warm and looks good but not well put together.. sad As I would be happy with a replacement of something better quality
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: A warm slightly tight fit
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and although it fits a little tight this is a nice coat. Warm but not bulky with special fittings at wrist and waist. Add something to go around your neck and your set! This is my new favorite winter/fall coat. Excellent shipping fast and the packaging was smart. I'd buy this again but it just might be a while before I need one.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Lighter winter coat
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent coat. My favorite part is the hood. I can leave my hat at home because it does an excellent job keeping my head warm. The whole coat blocks the wind really well. If exercising this is great. If you are holding still (not moving) in the cold weather sub 10 degrees F then this coat may be too light. Pros: Light, Blocks wind extremely well, excellent hood. Cons: Shell seems fragile (I have snagged it twice on metal fencing and it has held up so far but I am worried that I will get a tear)
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida. I traveled to Minnesota to see my family and temperatures got as low as 30 below zero. We're talking a 100 degree swing from stepping out my door in the morning to stepping off the plane later on. I did not ski or use it for the other purposes, but this jacket paid for itself many, many times over. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Making Reviews Great Again

customer_reviews.title: Quality is undependable. 1 lasted, 1 broke.
customer_reviews.text: I gave my husband this coat for Christmas. He wore it sledding with our son for ONE HOUR the next day, and this happened (see photo). The liner totally pulled out of the stitch, exposing the stuffing. I also bought the womens version for myself, which has been through a ski session and a wash/dry now, and admittedly seems to be doing ok, but my husband's was returned.
customer_reviews.author: abigail warnock

customer_reviews.title: Great addition. I put a fleece sweater under it ...
customer_reviews.text: By far the warmer coat I own. It has kept me warm in cold rainy days. It’s a little loose on me. The elastic waist is. Great addition. I put a fleece sweater under it and spent a weekend camping in sub-freezing temperatures and felt warm and cozy. I loved this coat so much that I bought one for each of my children and one for my mother. I broke one of the pocket zippers. It was my fault. I over stuffed the pocket and tried to force the zipper. The pockets are very big. I can fit a 1 liter stepper bottle and gloves and still zip it closed.
customer_reviews.author: CLM

customer_reviews.title: Far too small
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 6'1, 240lb husband. He usually wears an XL in most clothes. In this case I wanted a bigger coat so he could wear a sweater under the coat. Nope. He put the coat on over just a light shirt and the coat just barely zipped up. Barely at an XXXL. The 3XL was smaller than the typical 1XL. Not a quality coat at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mona11234

customer_reviews.title: Great all-weather coat
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these coat. I am 6'-1" tall and 195-lbs (athletic frame) and the coats fits perfectly with enough room to layer. Fabric is water repellant and slightly glossy. Chest pocket is perfect for either cell phone, or in my case, eye glasses. Has a waist draw string to snug up.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: -Inside pocket zipper broken on arrival (stitched over part of the zipper) -The main zipper was very difficult to get to actuall
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Warm Waterproof Windproof Cons: -Inside pocket zipper broken on arrival (stitched over part of the zipper) -The main zipper was very difficult to get to actually get started -Stitching is garbage. I wore the jacket one time and went skiing. One fall (where all I did was sit down) ripped the jacket from the left elbow all the way down the left side to the bottom of the jacket. The insulation inside the jacket was hanging out after this happened. Final thoughts: Save your money and buy a better quality jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Under $70 are you kidding me
customer_reviews.text: Just received this jacket as a quick fix need for a black ski jacket. I have various over $500 ski jackets but none are black. And wouldn't you know it I had to have a black ski jacket for some training with a local Ski Patrol outfit I joined. The jacket fits great and so far the quality looks more then adequate for a under $70 jacket. I'll see how it performs this weekend up in the mountains. But for the money, Great Jacket!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Arms are quite short.
customer_reviews.text: Jacket is lightweight but looks like it will be very warm. No zippers in the underarm so it it is too warm, will not be easy to vent. Quality is very good and I typically wear a medium and this medium seems true to size, other than the arms being about 2”-3” shorter than I would prefer. I’m anxious to try in in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one size up to compensate given earlier reviews so fits fine. Did not have any rips or tears as ...
customer_reviews.text: Updating original rating from 1 star to 4 star. Item was not delivered on time and update was vague on when it would get here. It arrived a couple of days late. Was as expected, although a little on the small side. Ordered one size up to compensate given earlier reviews so fits fine. Did not have any rips or tears as others have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: rs-first

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is exceptional, coat is a great value!!
customer_reviews.text: received a replacement from my original as the first one had a draw strong issue. The customer service was exceptional, communicated extremely well and prioritized my satisfaction above all else. For that alone I would buy more products through this company, the replacement came promptly and so far has a great fit, the faux fur interior lining is a nice soft, comfortable touch and holds in heat extremely well. It is a little puffy but not bad considering. It's weatherproof so water runs off it pretty well and although I haven't ran it through any crazy weather is holding up fine in northwest weather.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Burns

customer_reviews.title: Survived an East Coast (USA) Ski Trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought the jacket to go skiing in Vermont, NH. During the four days, the temperature ranged 9-31 degrees Fahrenheit. It was sometimes very windy, and sometimes very snowy. The jacket worked very well at insulating my body and I never felt cold. I fell many times and moisture was never able to get inside - there are several common ski jacket features that were included in the jacket, including an interior snap around the waist area, and exterior snap outside of the main zipper that keeps the hood down, and a piece that you can put over the thumb. Despite its heavy use, the jacket showed no signs of wear at the end of the trip.
customer_reviews.author: scott frost

customer_reviews.title: Solid Coat but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I just received this coat. I think I got one size too big but that is not the sellers fault. It will work on cold days with thick cloth on just fine. Coat is solid and seems to be of good quality. The only issue I have is that the outer layer feels cheap. Not sure how to describe that. It feels almost like processed paper but is fabric. I will let all know what it does as I use it but the zippers and fit are fine.
customer_reviews.author: TB03830

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this jacket over the weekend skiing all day. There's a lot detail in this jacket, with all the different pockets, button placements, how your hands go into these little pockets within the sleeve to keep the cold out. I was amazed that it kept me that warm and toasty but yet be pretty light. This is a great jacket and look forward to the years to wear it in the winters.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice coat!
customer_reviews.text: This coat is great. at my job im required to stand outside long enough for my clothes to loose all the warmth in them. This coat stops that. I've been out in 10°F for about a half hour or so with out getting cold. it features some great things like a snow skirt and little cuffs that keep your sleeves from riding up.
customer_reviews.author: franky

customer_reviews.title: Great, heavy jacket
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend this jacket enough for low temperature warmth. The hood is removable, lots of pockets on the inside for all of my gear, very warm but doesn’t feel bulky. I really like the built in, partial glove. I’m from Colorado. I snow ski. I’ve had a lot of jackets. This is by far my favorite and the best value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Margo Giordano

customer_reviews.title: I liked the coat for the most part...
customer_reviews.text: Im 6' and 170lbs. It mostly fit but felt a bit large around the torso - it bunched up and was a bit uncomfortable. I would have been ok with that, but there were a couple adjustment straps that were broken and looked frayed and about to break. The combination of everything made me return the jacket. I have yet to decide if I will try the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: bjorn i.

customer_reviews.title: Florida-born, transplanted to Illinois, no longer hates winter
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his coat! We moved to Illinois from Florida (where he was born and raised) and he had no idea what a "proper coat" was. He was wearing a thick sweatshirt in 0 degree weather. After this arrived, he told me he didn't know what he had been missing. It's very warm, but not overly bulky. He does have longer arms and if he puts his thumbs in the sleeves and stretches for something he says he can hear stitches pop.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Luxa

product_meta.title: Wantdo Men's Mountain Waterproof Ski Jacket Windproof Rain Jacket Winter Warm Snow Coat
feature_bullets: Warm Fabric: Professional water repellent coated, fuzzy lining and durable fabric with 240 g polyester fibre which guarantees the best heat retention. Relaxed-fit style with quick-dry material.
Waterproof: Water-repellent rain jacket can work under over 10000mm pressure head. Keep your body always dry and comfortable when you are outside, also can fights bad rainy or misty weather.

Windproof: 1) Adjustable hook & loop fastener cuffs and stretchable glove with thumb hole help seal in warmth. 2) Inside windproof snap skirt, internal drawcord hem, detachable and adjustable storm hood help to keep wind out. 3) Wear resisting soft shell is highly wind resistant.

Multi Pockets: 2 zippered hand pockets, 1 zippered chest pocket (passport or cards stowed), 1 internal big mesh pocket, 1 internal secure media pocket, suit for keys, mobilephone, wallet and other accessories. An earphone line fastening and supporting fixture available inside the jacket.
Size notes: Jacket offers a standard fit. Please choose by US size.
Best use: This windbreaker ski jacket is an ideal outfit for downhill skiing, snowboarding, snowsports, hiking, rock climbing and other winter outdoor sports.
